quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [as elevator door closes] Hold it!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [notices something new about Dwight] New glasses.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Dwight. What a ridiculous, fancy clown you are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am dressed according to the Schrute codes of mourning. My aunt Shirley has died.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, Dwight. I'm so sorry. Were you guys close?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I would say that she raised me, but let's not kid each other. I raised myself. She was, however, the closest thing I had to a mother.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My actual mother was very cold and distant. I'd say she was the closest thing I had to an aunt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: My condolences.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Keep them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. Now, what do we got in these two pails?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: In keeping with Schrute custom, I will either invite you to Saturday's funeral by sprinkling red, fertile dirt in your face. Or, I will ask you to keep a respectful distance during my time of grief, with a dusting of black, slightly acidic soil.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [after Dwight tosses dirt on her face] What color is it?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It looks pretty black.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [after Dwight tosses dirt in his face] Yep. Acidic, all right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [while Dwight prepares to toss dirt] Oh, thank god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'm so sorry, Dwight. And if you want me to be there, of course I will go. I just... have a personal training session...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK. That's not... [tosses red dirt in Oscar's face]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I get red dirt. Nobody is getting red dirt. I should've kept my mouth shut. We're not even that close. I've only known Dwight... 12 years. 12 years. Time is a son of a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [as Dwight prepares to throw dirt in his face] I'm sure... I'm sure she's in a better place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I really hope so. [unexpectedly tosses dirt in Pam's face]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. [as Dwight mixes coffee with dirt in his hand] This is crazy. You can't make a dirt ball.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I miss her so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know? [Dwight screams and throws dirt ball at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.line: [playing guitar and singing 'Oh What a Beautiful Morning'] Zeke's here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Zeke.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight. Mose, Mom says 'hi'.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.line: 'Hi' to Mom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you going?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.line: Will there be ghosts there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [simultaneously with Zeke] Get in the sidecar. Get in the sidecar.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: You get in the sidecar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [at the grave site, to Oscar] What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You invited me. You threw the red dirt in my face.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [smirking] Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [as a car approaches the grave site] Who is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jeb, my brother.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You have a brother?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: I didn't really see a better parking spot. [drives into the dug grave] Whoa! Look what I did. It's a rental. [Dwight approaches and hugs him] You wanna go in? [both attempt to put the other in the dug grave]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [upon seeing Todd Packer enter the office] Oh, gosh.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey, Moonface. Nice to see those shiny, little Chinese eyes of yours.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: [to Pam] Who's this guy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: … bad.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hi, all.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Why are you here, Todd?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: OK. Let's get right to it. I guess. My name is Todd Packer and I am in recovery. I'm working the steps. I'm on step eight of Alcoholics Anonymous and step nine of Narcotics Anonymous. I'm here to make amends. I've been hard to deal with over the past years. Kind of a jerk. I know it. I don't need you to accept my apology, but I'd love it if you did.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Packer, we accept. [others disagree]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Actually, they have a specific way I need to do this. And, I have to go through examples of stuff.  OK. Uh, where to begin. [to Pam] Hey. Pam-pam and her pam-pams. Wow. I have said some crude things about those. But, they are beautiful. And, I guess that's why I acted out. Pam, I'm sorry I objectified you. And, personified your breasts. Sorry, guys. [to Phyllis] Oh boy. I have not been nice to you. Philly, I'm sorry for the things I said about your size. To your face, behind your back, and in the form of drawings. Actually, that goes to all you double XLs. Stanley, Kevin, [points to Clark] this kid in a few years.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Todd, you're just saying insults in the form of an apology.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Why can't I just be nice? Truth is, I really like you guys. I really do. OK. The apology’s just half of it. The big thing is making amends. And, that's why I brought these. I went out to the Steamtown Mall and I got you all cupcakes. From that place 'Nipples'.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think it's called 'Nibbles'.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Huh. The mind sees what it wants to, huh? [hands cupcake to Erin] There you go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, hey, guys. Wait. Before we accept these cupcakes, I think we need to have a conversation privately in the conference room. Don't eat the cupcake.

quotes.speaker: German Minister
quotes.line: We are here today to join this woman and the ground. Man is born of woman and his life is full of turmoil.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: [gathers and tastes soil] Huh. It's crap soil. Nothing's going to grow here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Doesn't matter. It's a cemetery.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Yeah, well, I'm just saying it's garbage soil, that's all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, the only thing we're planting here is dead bodies.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: It's fine 'cause they're not going to grow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, thank god they're not because we don't want to make zombies.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Good. I agree. Don't worry about it. You won't get any.

quotes.speaker: German Minister
quotes.line: Would the family care to say something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You had black hair and then gray hair.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: You were the aunt to my cousins. Most of your life you were 5'4”, at the end you were 5'1”.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: They're a descriptive people.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: [approaches and hugs Dwight] I see you started without me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You were late. So, what am I supposed to do?

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Well, I told you...

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Hi, Fannie. Fannie: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Who is that?

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Dwight's sister.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Dwight has a sister?

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: She's beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Blugh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to his nephew Cameron] Hello, little man. Haven't seen you in a few years. [after a weak handshake] What is this? Oh, god. [after a truck with many girls in the bed pulls up] Henry.

quotes.speaker: Henry
quotes.line: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I see Esther's back in town.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.line: Hi Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hi Esther. Nice of you to come today.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.line: This was on the way. We're going into town after. I need yarn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, if you can snap two chicken necks with a single motion, why use two motions to slaughter those chickens.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: We're at a funeral. There's a funeral going on here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Henry
quotes.line: Anyone mention her height?

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Henry
quotes.line: Land size? [all shake heads] [removes hat] Shirley, at 1600 acres, you have the largest farm in the area. Sharing borders with six other farms. Including my own farm. And your nephew Dwight's. [replaces hat] OK. [drives away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So, let's get it going.

quotes.speaker: German Minister
quotes.line: [approaches Fannie, offering a shotgun] Would you want to do the honors?

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Oh, right. Uh, you know, I don't think we have to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We Schrutes don't need some Harvard doctor to tell us who's alive and who's dead. But, there was an unlucky streak of burying some heavy sleepers. And, when grave robbers discovered some scratch marks on the inside of some of the coffins, we decided to make sure that our dead were completely dead. Out of kindness.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [after Dwight opens coffin and begins firing into it] That's it for me. [exits]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't think we should eat Packers' cupcakes. We can't give him the satisfaction.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I agree. Even though that place has a way of making those cupcakes so they're dense. But, they're also really fluffy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We can't let him buy our forgiveness with cupcakes. He was awful to us. And, he still is. How much is a cupcake? $2.50? Is that the price of our dignity?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: $3.75 a cupcake, actually. $3.67 if you buy a dozen.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I never forget a number. Names? In one ear and out the other. Places? Nope. Faces? That's rich. But, numbers? I have a gift. I guess that's why I'm an accountant.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hey, man. I don't think we've met. I'm Clark.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Oh. I'm Todd. Oh, sorry for calling you a fat, little runt earlier.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: You didn't actually say that.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: No? Wow. I'm in this mode now where I'm apologizing for thoughts that are in my head. [Clark fake laughs] Hey. I have a crazy feeling [hands Clark a cupcake] that you are really gonna like this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Maybe we should eat the cupcakes. Haven't we done enough to Packer? I mean, we sent him down to Florida on a prank. [to Nellie] And you did fire him.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I did. I did, yes. And it was purely political. He did nothing wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Would any of you be saying any of this if the cupcakes were from Supermart?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do they even have a bakery anymore?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: They do. It's awful. And, it's getting worse every day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, it really is just about the cupcakes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wow, you're right. It is just about the cupcakes.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: So, we're all agreed? No one touches those cupcakes?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [as all agree] OK.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: OK. Packer can go to hell.

quotes.speaker: Aunt Shirley
quotes.line: [on a recorded video] Thank you for coming to my funeral. As I gaze at life's big sunset, I can't help but wonder where it all went wrong. You've all disappointed me greatly. Fannie. A single mamma in the city.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [agreeing with Shirley] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Aunt Shirley
quotes.line: Jeb. A street pusher.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: After I left the army, I bought a 9-acre worm farm from a Californian. Turns out “worm” means something else out there. And, I am now in the business of... pain management. Or, the smoking of pain management.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can't stand the fact that Jeb is a pot farmer. He could've grown anything. Anything in the world. He used to talk about growing a peanut-grape hybrid. One plant, one sandwhich.

quotes.speaker: Aunt Shirley
quotes.line: We can't just sit by and watch our family farm disappear. So, here are my terms. Dwight, Fannie, Jeb. If you come back home, I will leave you my farm. So, there, you have it.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Is she crazy? [as Dwight considers] Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Buddy? Buddy?

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Snap out of it. Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let's do this. Let's run Aunt Shirley's farm. I'm in. Boom.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: No, no, no. I'm not moving back here. Are you crazy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Of course you are.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Look. I, I don't want to be mean or like insulting. I know that you like it here. But, Dwight, it's just that farm life lacks a certain... sort of sophistication.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: That Cammy and I are drawn to. And, I don't know. The men are just... it's almost like there's a... a willing ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Yes. I, thank you for asking me. I actually have written a little bit of poetry. That's crazy. And, I was recently published. Which is just... [reaches in to bag, removes folded paper] maybe I have. Yep. I do. Here it is from the um, Hartford Women's Lit Quarterly.com. A Willing Ignorance by Fannie Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Totally. Yep. The people here are like [makes farting sound, laughs] Like a fart. You know what I'm saying? Like a fart?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? Let's take a couple of nights and stay here and think about Aunt Shirley's offer.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Couple of nights couldn't hurt.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Uh, somehow how I think a couple of nights could hurt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You will say 'yes' on one. Five, four, three, two, get ready to say 'yes', one. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: [as Dwight says 'yes'] Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Zeke
quotes.line: Growing up with Dwight and Mose was not easy. Uh, Dwight was obviously the cool one. And, Mose was the visionary. Which left me to be the comedian.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: That doesn't work on me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: By the way, that's not...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [counts down in French]

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Very funny. OK. Oui, oui, oui.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oui.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Oh my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [while everyone is gathered playing and singing “Sons & Daughters”] People underestimate the power of nostalgia. If baseball can use it to get people to care about that worthless sport, then I can use it to get my siblings to care about the farm. Nostalgia is truly one of the great human weaknesses. Second only to the neck.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: [after seeing Dwight lay something down in front of Esther] So, I forgot about this old custom. If a man is interested in courting a woman, he may throw the beaks of a crow at her. And then, if she's interested in accepting the courtship, she has to destroy the beaks. [Esther crushes the beaks leaving Dwight satisfied]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey, uh, I just wanted to say I'm sorry for screwing you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I'm not sorry about it.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: I am. It was my rock bottom.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [while Kevin stares at his cupcake] Kevin, you can do this.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You don't know that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kevin, um, let's think of something to distract us. Uh, like the movie Skyfall. You loved the movie Skyfall, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: James Bond was a spy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes. He was a good spy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. He was the best. James Bond would love this cupcake.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Hey, you know what? It was, uh, great to see you all again. Take care. [exits]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: I am going through a twelve-step program. I'm currently on step zero. Which is have a [expletive] of fun. I spent six hours carefully removing the frosting and then layering in a variety of drugs, some legal, some not. Some laxative, some constipating. You don't fire the Pac-Man and expect to get away with it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Guys, I'm proud of us. I think we did the right thing. [after noticing Angela easting cupcake] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [as others eat] Wait!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: He's gone. It's just a cupcake now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, no. It's the principle of the thing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [exits office, chewing] Oh my god. I forgive him so much. [Kevin begins making choking sounds] Whoa, is he choking?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [after long choking and refusing help from Meredith] Oh, that was fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: [after following Dwight to the chicken coop, before sunrise] Is it dangerous to take the eggs in front of them?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, very. You really need to stand back because these are killer chickens.

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: I was just asking you something I didn't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Which is fine. And, you learned something. But, it was kind of a stupid question so you're gonna get made fun of a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: [after grabbing an egg] Are we gonna eat these today?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If you want.

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: Is that a guillotine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This? No. That'd be cool, though. It's for milking.

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: [referencing goat] That's a cow?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Did you just ask me if this was a cow?

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: [after seeing Dwight smelling milk] What are you doing now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come here. Come on. Grab a teat with each hand. Sit down. There you go. Squeeze from top to bottom. Really pull. Use some muscle. Draw the milk out. All right. Going all right?

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, is the udder hot? Is the milk clumpy?

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: I don't know any of that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, you suck at this. Give me those teats. Didn't your father teach you anything?

quotes.speaker: Cameron
quotes.line: I never met him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good morning, Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [looking disheveled] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, everybody. Um, I decided to eat my cupcake. I thought about it last night. I talked to Jim. I talked to my sister. And, I think that, as long as Todd Packer doesn't know, it's OK.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I don't care what you do, Pam. Just please stop making noise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Packer laced the cupcakes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Did you get diarrhea or were you stoned?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Some of us got both. [raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh my god! Is everyone OK?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Last night, I got out all of my old dolls and played with them on the living room floor. Then, I ordered ten American Girl outfits online. It was thousands of dollars.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Yeah? Well, count yourself lucky, Phyllis. I got the toilet.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Me too. [holds up four fingers]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I went Christmas caroling in March and I fertilized some bushes along the way. So, not my best night. But, not my worst night.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What did you do, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Last night? Oh, god, um, I don't know. [cuts to him arm wrestling Kevin] Na, nothing really. Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Why would you ask me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm not, a... I'm just. I don't know. [cuts to him spinning a plate like a record and Kevin dancing] Oh. Gosh. I actually. It is hard to recall. Um. [cuts to he and Kevin sitting on a table touching each others face] Pretty normal night.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [he and Andy embrace each other in tears] My night was just like that. [cuts to him and Andy trading clothes] Meaning normal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. I didn't see you last night at all. [cuts to him dancing by prostrate Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nope. I did not see you either.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow. He is officially the worst human being.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [as Pam attempts to throw cupcake away] Ah. [stops Pam and takes cupcake]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But, Kevin that's...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. No, I understand, Pam. I understand.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [shaking head in disbelief] No.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: So, that's it. I just wanted to make amends. [slides cupcakes across table to Darryl and Jim]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That's big of you, man. Takes a lot of courage.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ooh, red velvet. I should apologize too.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: It's OK. I'm over it.

quotes.speaker: Jeb
quotes.line: Oof. This is no nine-acre worm farm. This is a beast. Whoever's managing this thing is gonna have a hell of a job. Not it.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: Not it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It. [to Fannie] That kid doesn't put in some farm time, he's gonna stay like that.

quotes.speaker: Fannie
quotes.line: All right.
